III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/21/25, a youth punched a refrigerator after getting irritated
with staff and asked for medical attention multiple times. The
youth was not taken for medical attention until 7/25/25 and was
diagnosed with a fractured pinky finger.
The staff member present with the youth wanted the youth
transferred to another hospital that was not appropriate to meet
the youth's physical and mental health needs and there is a
concern that they were trying to deter the youth from disclosing
neglect.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 08/08/2025.
Complainant does not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed at Girlstown on 07/24/2025 for
investigation 2025SIC0000872 and observed wearing a splint on
her right pinky finger. Youth A stated she obtained the splint from
a peer after she punched the refrigerator on 07/20/2025 when she
was upset with Staff 1. Youth A stated it was not worth explaining
why she was upset. Youth A stated she refused a telehealth
appointment for her hand on 07/22/2025 because she wanted to
be seen in person at an off-site location. Youth A’s right hand was
not observed as swollen or bruised in comparison to her left hand.
Youth A denied pain in her right pinky or hand. Youth A did not
want to remove her splint for viewing of her right pinky.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Girlstown on 07/30/2025 with another
Department of Health and Human Service Worker (DHHS)
Worker. Staff 1 stated Youth A refused a metal detector wand
search when she returned from truancy, used profanity, and hit
the refrigerator once with her hand. Staff 1 stated she called for
assistance and Staff 3 responded and de-escalated Youth A. Staff
1 stated Youth A’s knuckle below her pinky finger (does not recall
right or left hand) slightly swelled without discoloration. Staff 1
2

stated Youth A did not complain of pain but Staff 3 gave Youth A a
finger splint, wrapped her hand in an ace bandage, and an ice
pack. Staff 1 stated Youth A was scheduled for a hand evaluation
on either 07/21/2025 or 07/22/2025 but she refused to attend.
Staff 1 stated Youth A did not complain of hand pain but wore a
splint on her pinky finger.
Staff 2 was interviewed by phone on 08/08/2025. Staff 2 stated
she noticed Youth A with a splint on her finger (does not recall
which finger or hand) on 07/22/2025 and asked Youth A what
happened. Staff 2 stated Youth A told her that she punched the
refrigerator because Staff 1 upset her. Staff 2 stated Youth A did
not explain what transpired between her and Staff 1. Staff 2 stated
she took Youth A to an urgent care on 07/25/2025 to get an x-ray
of her finger when Youth A complained that her finger hurt and
Staff 2 observed Youth A’s finger to be purple and green. Staff 2
stated the x-ray machine was not working at the urgent care and
they went to another urgent care. Staff 2 stated she encouraged
Youth A to talk with the doctor because Youth A expressed
suicidal ideation about returning to Girlstown because of Staff 1’s
attitude towards her. Staff 2 stated the urgent care doctor spoke
with Program Manager about sending Youth A to Mott Children
Hospital. Staff 2 stated Program Manager requested Youth A go
to Beaumont Hospital due to staffing needs but it was decided for
Staff 2 to go with Youth A to Mott Children Hospital.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 08/19/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
Youth A went into the kitchen and Staff 1 redirected Youth A to
step out of the kitchen (does not recall date of the incident). Staff 3
stated Youth A became upset and punched the refrigerator. Staff
3 stated she gave Youth A an ice pack and Staff 1 gave Youth A a
finger splint when Youth A complained of hand pain. Staff 3 stated
she did not recall which hand or finger was injured but the finger
was slightly swollen. Staff 3 stated she saw Youth A the next day
and gave her another ice pack. Staff 3 stated Youth A had a
telehealth appointment scheduled for her hand but Youth A told
her that she wanted to be seen in person off site and refused the
telehealth appointment.
Clinical Coordinator was interviewed at Girlstown on 07/30/2025
with another DHHS Worker. Clinical Coordinator stated she was
not present when Youth A punched the refrigerator on 07/20/2025.
Clinical Coordinator stated Youth A became upset during a house
meeting on 07/21/2025 and went into the dining room and banged
her hand four times on the dining room table while wearing a splint
on her pinky. Clinical Coordinator stated Youth A had a telehealth
3

appointment to evaluate her hand on 07/22/2025 or 07/23/2025
but refused the appointment for unknown reason. Clinical
Coordinator was unaware of how Youth A received the finger
splint.
Case Manager was interviewed at Girlstown on 07/30/2025 with
another DHHS Worker. Case Manager stated Youth A became
upset during a house meeting on 07/21/2025 and walked into the
dining room with Clinical Coordinator following. Case Manager
stated she heard Youth A hit the dining room table. Case Manager
stated Youth A complained of hand pain on 07/22/2025 and she
noticed Youth A wearing a splint on her pinky finger (does not
recall which hand). Case Manager stated a telehealth appointment
was scheduled for 07/22/2025. Case Manager stated she
canceled Youth A’s telehealth appointment when Program
Manager told her that Youth A did not want to go. Case Manager
stated the telehealth appointment would assess if Youth A needed
to go to urgent care. Case Manager stated she is unaware of
Youth A hitting the refrigerator on 07/20/2025.
Program Manager was interviewed at Girlstown on 07/30/2025
with another DHHS Worker. Program Manager stated Youth A
punched the refrigerator on 07/20/2025 and punched the dining
room table on 07/21/2025. Program Manager stated Youth A had
a telehealth appointment to evaluate her hand on 07/22/2025 but
it was canceled when Youth A said she was not going. Program
Manager stated she worked on 07/25/2025 and Youth A did not
complain of finger or hand pain but later received a phone call
from Supervisor about Staff 2 taking Youth A for an evaluation for
finger pain and suicidal ideation. Program Manager stated Staff 2
was directed to go to another urgent care when the x-ray machine
was not working at the first urgent care. Program Manager stated
this urgent care ordered Youth A be sent to Mott Children Hospital
for an assessment. Program Manager stated she requested Youth
A to go to Beaumont Hospital-Wayne due to another youth being
there with staff but agreed for Youth A’s transport to Mott Children
Hospital with staffing.
Supervisor was interviewed at Girlstown on 07/30/2025 with
another DHHS Worker. Supervisor stated she was not present
when Youth A punched the refrigerator on 07/20/2025. Supervisor
stated Youth A’s Foster Care Worker visited Youth A on
07/21/2025 and Youth A did not complain of a hand injury to her.
Supervisor stated Youth A punched the dining room table on
07/21/2025, which may have caused further injury to her hand.
Supervisor stated Case Manager scheduled a 07/22/2025
4

telehealth appointment for Youth A’s hand but it was canceled
when Youth A said, “I’m not fucking doing it. They not fucking
gonna do anything”. Supervisor stated Staff 2 texted her on
07/25/2025 stating Youth A’s finger was turning green and maybe
it was infected. Supervisor stated she reached out to Program
Manager and it was determined to send Youth A to the local
urgent care. Supervisor stated Staff 2 took Youth A to another
urgent care after learning the x-ray machine was down at the first
urgent care. Supervisor stated Youth A was transferred to Mott
Children Hospital from urgent care and then admitted to Harbor
Oaks Hospital.
Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on
08/04/2025 by telephone. FCW stated she saw Youth A on
07/21/2025 at Girlstown but did not view Youth A’s pinky due to
the splint on the pinky. FCW stated Program Manager told her that
Youth A did not complain of hand injury after hitting the
refrigerator.
Video
07/20/2025 Video shows Youth A in the kitchen with Staff 1. Youth
A turns and hits the refrigerator one time with her right hand and
moves away from the refrigerator. There is no sound in the video
footage.
07/21/2025 Video shows Youth A in the dining room with a staff
person and hits the dining room table one time with her left hand.
There is no sound in the video footage.
Documentation
07/20/2025 incident report written by Staff 1 and Staff 2 states
Youth A refused to be searched after her return from truancy.
Youth A became upset and hit the refrigerator.
07/21/2025 incident report written by Clinical Coordinator states
Youth A went into the dining room when she became upset with
other youths. Youth A used profanity and hit her hand
aggressively on the table at least four times and was de-
escalated.
07/22/2025 incident report written by Case Manager states Youth
A was scheduled on 07/22/2025 to have her hand/knuckle
assessed from punching the refrigerator. Youth A stated she did
not want the appointment and the appointment was canceled.
5

07/25/2025 Youth A was seen at Trinity Health Urgent Care.
Youth A’s right hand was x-rayed and diagnosed with minimally
displaced fracture of the neck of the right fifth metacarpal with
slight volar angulation at the fracture site with associated soft
tissue swelling. Youth A was provided a splint and referred for
orthopedic follow up. Emergency Medical Services was called to
transport Youth A to Mott Children’s Hospital.
07/25/2025 Youth A was seen at Mott Children’s Hospital for
suicide ideation and her hand injury. Mott Children’s Hospital was
active in psychiatric planning and placed an ulnar gutter splint on
Youth A’s right hand.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for scheduling a telehealth
appointment for Youth A’s right hand on 07/22/2025 after she hit
the refrigerator on 07/20/2025. Youth A refused this telehealth
appointment and taken to Trinity Health Urgent Care on
07/25/2025. Youth A was diagnosed with a fracture in her right
pinky. Youth A was transported from urgent care to Mott Children
Hospital on 07/25/2025 for further evaluation.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has increased suicidal ideations since being placed and it is
unknown if her mental health needs are being met at the facility.
Another staff member encouraged a youth to drown themselves
after the youth disclosed suicidal ideations.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 08/08/2025.
Complainant does not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/24/2025 at Girlstown and stated
Staff 1 was not professional. Youth A stated Staff 1 told her to go
6

across the street to the lake and drown herself if she was suicidal.
Youth A stated she did not go across the street or self-harm at the
facility following this comment. Youth A stated she does not recall
the date this occurred but Youth B was a witness and may know
the date this occurred. Youth A stated she has telehealth
appointments with her therapist once or twice a week. Youth A
denied having current thoughts of self-harm.
Youth B was interviewed on 07/24/2025 at Girlstown. Youth B
was asked to describe Staff 1. Youth B stated Staff 1 is “an adult
bully” and provided the example of Staff 1 bringing up and joking
about a youth’s truancy in a sarcastic manner. Youth B was asked
if Staff 1 ever talked about the lake across the street. Youth B
said, “Oh yeah Staff 1 said, ‘If you want to kill yourself there’s a
lake across the street’ to Youth A.” Youth B did not recall the date
of this incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 07/30/2025 at Girlstown with another
DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated she would immediately notify
Supervisor or call the suicide crisis line if a youth had suicidal
ideation. Staff 1 denied hearing any staff encourage a youth to
self-harm. Staff 1 denied telling a youth to drown herself in the
lake across the street from the facility. Staff 1 denied joking about
youth truanting from the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed by phone on 08/08/2025. Staff 2
described Staff 1 as “hard core” and asked to explain what she
meant. Staff 2 stated hearing Staff 1 say, “Why you tell us. Just
AWOL. I’m not gonna look for you” when Youth A verbalized a
desire to truant. Staff 2 stated Youth A remained upset but did not
truant following Staff 1’s comments. Staff 2 stated she did not hear
Staff 1 tell Youth A to go across the street and jump in the lake,
but Youth A told her that Staff 1 said this to her. Staff 2 stated
Youth A never verbalized suicidal ideation to her but she would
notify Supervisor if this occurred.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 08/19/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
she is a midnight shift staff but does work morning and afternoon
shifts on occasion. Staff 3 denied yelling or threatening a youth.
Staff 3 stated she has not witnessed or overhead a staff yell,
threaten, or be verbally abusive to a youth.
Supervisor was interviewed on 07/30/2025 at Girlstown.
Supervisor stated she never heard a staff threaten a youth or
encourage a youth to self-harm.
7

Program Manager was interviewed on 07/30/2025 at Girlstown
with another DHHS Worker. Program Manager stated Youth A has
weekly telehealth sessions with a therapist and monthly telehealth
sessions with a nurse practitioner. Program Manager stated
Girlstown has been unable to hire an in-house therapist since
Covid.
Clinical Coordinator was interviewed on 07/30/2025 at Girlstown
with another DHHS Worker. Clinical Coordinator stated when a
youth expresses suicidal ideation she is placed on a safety plan or
seen by a telehealth nurse practitioner or therapist or in person at
New Oakland for an assessment.
Documentation
Girlstown utilizes the American Association of Suicidology crisis
hotline telephone number as a resource when a youth has suicidal
ideation.
Girlstown’s Behavioral Management Policy states staff are
prohibited in “Mental or emotional cruelty, such as humiliating,
sharing or frightening a child this includes threatening harm or
swearing/cursing (Using foul language) at them.”
Staff 1 was hired in 03/2023. Staff 1 was disciplined in 08/2023 for
a supervision issue.
Staff 2 was hired in 06/2025. Staff 2 does not have a discipline
history.
Staff 3 was hired in 07/2024. Staff 3 was disciplined in 02/2025 for
bedtime room checks and disciplined in 04/2025 for a supervision
issue.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance because Youth A and
Youth B’s interview state Staff 1 verbally prompted Youth A to go
across the street to the lake and drown when she expressed
suicidal ideation.
CONSULTATION
Girlstown youths may benefit from the option of live, in person
appointments in conjunction with telehealth appointments.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

Corrective Action Plan approved 06/12/2025
8

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149 Resident nutrition.
Section (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible meals
Description daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth is allergic to fish and continues to be served fish at the
facility. Allergies and specialty diets are not accommodated.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 08/08/2025.
Complainant does not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/24/2025 at Girlstown. Youth A did
not state having concerns with her shellfish allergy when she was
asked at the conclusion of her interview if she had other concerns
with her stay at Girlstown. Youth A was interviewed on 07/28/2025
at Harbor Oaks by another DHHS Worker. Youth A stated she is
allergic to shellfish and not supposed to eat fish as a precaution.
Youth A stated she was served shrimp and fish and not provided a
substitute menu item at Girlstown.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 08/08/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated a
food allergy list is posted in the kitchen. Staff 2 stated an
alternative food item is provided to the youth if the meal has a
youth’s allergy item.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 08/19/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
everyone knew Youth A is allergic to shellfish and a food allergy
list is posted in the kitchen. Staff 3 stated chicken was provided as
an alternative to shrimp when it was on the menu. Staff 3 stated
shrimp is served less often due to Youth A’s allergy to shellfish.
Clinical Coordinator was interviewed on 07/30/2025 at Girlstown
with another DHHS Worker. Clinical Coordinator stated Youth A is
not allergic to fish but allergic to shellfish. Clinical Coordinator
stated Youth A’s shellfish allergy is posted in the kitchen as a
reminder and Youth A is provided an alternative when shellfish is
served.
Program Manager and Supervisor were interviewed on
07/30/2025 at Girlstown with another DHHS Worker. Program
Manager stated any known youth food allergy is documented and
posted in the kitchen. Program and Supervisor stated youths with
documented food allergies are provided a substitute when their
9

allergy item is served. Supervisor provided a food substitution
example for Youth A’s shellfish allergy. Supervisor stated if shrimp
fettucine alfredo is served, Youth A is served chicken fettucine
alfredo or may choose to eat a sandwich, which is a standing
alternative.
Documentation
Toured Girlstown’s kitchen on 07/30/2025. A colorful allergy list is
posted in the kitchen. The list states Youth A has a shellfish
allergy.
Girlstown’s menus from 05/05/2025 to 08/03/2025 were reviewed.
An alternative to fish and shellfish are identified on the menu as
follows:
• 05/25/2025 Butterfly shrimp or chicken nuggets alternative
for dinner
• 05/29/2025 Plain or shrimp fettucine alfredo alternative for
dinner
• 06/13/2025 Salmon or chicken alternative for dinner
Analysis The agency is found in compliance by providing substitute options
to Youth A’s allergy to shellfish.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
